thread.title: Ex-Premier League goalkeeper Lutz Pfannenstiel quizzed by cops over theft of PENGUIN
thread.title_full: Ex-Premier League goalkeeper Lutz Pfannenstiel quizzed by cops over theft of PENGUIN - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Ex-Premier League goalkeeper Lutz Pfannenstiel quizzed by cops over theft of PENGUIN
text:
Ex-Premier League goalkeeper Lutz Pfannenstiel quizzed by cops over theft of PENGUIN The madcap goalkeeper received a call from the authorities after a penguin went missing from an animal park, but he pleads his innocence Share Comments By Mark Jones 17:16, 16 FEB 2017 Sport This man is the reason they say goalkeepers are mad daily updates To steal a penguin once is a pretty strange thing to do. But to do it twice? That's madness.
And that's exactly what the former Wimbledon and Nottingham Forest goalkeeper Lutz Pfannenstiel DIDN'T do, despite being quizzed by the cops recently.
The well-travelled 43-year-old - who is a scout at German club Hoffenheim these days - has also been on the books at Bradford Park Avenue and Huddersfield Town during a bizarre and varied career, and he's found himself at the centre of a penguin puzzler for the second time according to reports in German paper Bild.
A penguin - definitely not being stolen (Photo: RALPH LEE HOPKINS/National Geographic) Because when the flightless bird disappeared from an animal park in Mannheim, an anonymous call to cops suggested the ex-keeper was the culprit.
“The police phoned me about a stolen penguin," Pfannenstiel told reporters. "They had received an anonymous tip-off that I might be involved.
“But it wasn’t me. I urge the thief to return the penguin, as this is no joke. I know it well from the sins of my youth."
Lutz's book was a big hit Because it seems as though the person who 'reported' Pfannenstiel did so because of a story in the German's epic 2014 autobiography , in which he explains what he did when playing in New Zealand 14 years ago.
“In 2003 I took a penguin home from its colony and put it in my bathtub," he explains, matter-of-factly. "But I returned it inside two days after my club chairman explained penguins were a protected species.
“Besides, my housemates were not delighted, as it stank like a fish factory. I did not steal it – I just borrowed it.”
He just borrowed it, okay?!
Like any normal person would.
Although given that this is a man who once spent 101 days in a Singaporean jail and was once declared dead on the pitch, then who knows what normal is when it comes to him?
poll loading Would you ever steal a penguin? 0+ VOTES SO FAR Yeah, obviously I'd have nowhere to put it WTF even is this?! Daily Newsletter Follow @MirrorRowZed Subscribe to our Daily newsletter Lutz Pfannenstiel Premier League Police
